lexUnit.name: caution.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say something as a warning

sentence.text: ` Now do n't do anything silly , " Bedelia cautioned .
` I think you 'd better stay at home , " Otley cautioned .
` Hush ! " she cautioned .
` Do n't be too greedy , " Littlejohn cautioned .
` Not just any keys mind , " Rain cautioned , and stressed the value of the desk keys .
` No orgies now ! " cautioned the honourable lady .
People often change their minds -- a woman 's biological clock often asserts itself in her mid 30s , " cautions Jane .
The CBI cautioned that the rise in mortgage rates would feed through into pressure for higher pay , raising the prospect of wage inflation and undermining businesses .
Eric Pickles , leader of Bradford Council , cautioned that it took time to get budgets under control .
Mr Dewhirst said he was very optimistic , but cautioned that a Labour government would mean more job losses .
I must however caution that financial and other constraints compel us to plan more conservatively than I imagine you would wish .
Warning that without it and a massive programme of private investment the reform movement could fail , he cautioned that " there will be no second try " .
However they caution that the relatively small numbers of students in both studies makes it difficult to draw any firm generalisable conclusions .
The Chancellor cautioned that uncertainties remained , however .
The CSO cautioned it regarded comparisons of the volume figures as distorted by the impact of the dock strike on August and September returns .
Had not her sister Alice cautioned her of the dangers in being alone with a man , now that she had reached marriageable age ?
Furthermore , ` there have been questions about his loyalty " , for Alderson has had the temerity to caution the service about an apparent drift towards paramilitarism .
A storm forced her boat into Dublin , where she met the deputy , Henry Cromwell , and cautioned him about his treatment of Quakers .
She constantly needed to caution him about the many dangers he was either too young or too stupid to recognize for himself .
He would later swear that he had cautioned me about this the previous night .
More sympathetic souls cautioned me against hasty decisions , but the ripples subsided fairly quickly .
It ordered the Galway County Inspector to caution Mrs Joyce for the offence she had committed against the Aliens Restriction Order .
The best thing for this chap would be to caution him for this offence .
Before being charged with being a common prostitute , loitering or soliciting etc. the police should first caution the woman on two occasions for loitering or soliciting etc .
I caution my hon. Friend about using those figures .
They should therefore caution us against being overly dogmatic .
I would caution care in buying though , and can not stress this strongly enough .
` It 's a lot deeper than it looks , " she cautioned the children .
If he did n't want to go to court for a very minor offence , then you could caution him .
The police took what may or may not have been three different names and addresses and cautioned the men .
The police simply cautioned the man , but they say that with so many vehicles having had to break and swerve , it 's a miracle there was n't a serious accident .
Joolz was cautioned by the police for swearing at a heckler who swore at her .
He was just cautioned by the superintendent .
Mr Cole appeared before the Board and acknowledged that the Coffin was not made according to his Contract whereupon he was strongly cautioned by the Chairman as to his future conduct .
The Bishop retired after he was cautioned by the police for the offences .
Fourteen boys at Rhydd Court School near Malvern have been cautioned by police after younger pupils were allegedly abused by older ones .
Judges are cautioned against offering any further explanation of ` reasonable doubt . "
O'Neill was also cautioned as tempers frayed .
Make sure you lock your door , " she told Christina , undoubtedly deriving great satisfaction as the secure are apt to do when cautioning the vulnerable to be on their guard .
` I have to ask you some things , " she cautioned him tightly , finally stepping round the coffee-table and seating herself .
He cautioned them to avoid crossing the Waste but to cling instead to the edge of the forest .

But he cautions the prosperous townie newcomer that money and ambition will count for nothing : ` You must wait patiently for acceptance into the village , and learn to share the atavistic values of the region . "
Though Mr Pilkington cautions against over-optimistic expectations , he is confident that the visioncare business is firmly on track .
On the other hand , theorists in the field of Cultural Studies caution against any simple notion that exposure of individuals to cultural representations modifies their behaviour .
Alan Travis cautions against parallels with Powell 's ` river of blood " campaign .
But the doctors cautioned against blue skies forever .
Hamish Deans and his son George Deans , both directors of Falkirk FC , have been interviewed and cautioned by police .
